title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Miners' industry body seeks rise in customs duty on aluminium imports to 15%
GE Aerospace to invest $14M at Pune facility
items.summary: - GE Aerospace will invest $14M at its *Pune facility* to boost capacity and upgrade automation for **advanced engine components**, reinforcing the **Make in India** initiative.\n- The site is *ISO 14001* and *ISO 45001* certified, with **300+ suppliers** and more than **5,000 trained associates**, reflecting sustainability and broad aerospace capability.\n- GE’s Pune operations use the **FLIGHT DECK** lean model to raise efficiency and support India’s growing role in global aerospace manufacturing, aligned with the **Make in India** program.

items.title: Kamdhenu Paints opens new depot in Mayapuri to strengthen supply network in Delhi NCR
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Kamdhenu Paints* opened a new depot in *Mayapuri* to strengthen supply and improve last-mile service for distributors and customers across *Delhi NCR*.
- A showroom-cum-experience centre in *Kirti Nagar* will showcase *decorative paints* and *wood coatings* with on-site demos for architects and designers.
- The expansion, backed by investments in *logistics* and *technical support*, aims to deepen market presence and ensure end-users have access to the right products.

items.title: This homegrown startup bets on AI-led video analytics to drive industrial automation
Eight core industries flat in Oct; fertilisers, steel up
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The Oct 2025 core index was flat YoY, with fertilisers *+7.4%*, steel *+6.7%*, cement *+5.3%*, and refinery products *+4.6%*, as eight core industries account for about *40%* of IIP. 
- Coal, natural gas, crude oil and electricity contracted, dragging momentum: coal *-8.5%*, natural gas *-5%*, crude oil *-1.2%*, electricity *-7.6%*. 
- April–October 2025–26 growth stood at *2.5% (provisional)*; steel *+10.3%*, cement *+7.3%*, fertilisers *+0.7%*, refinery products *+0.4%* in that period, with September 2025 revised to *3.3%*.

items.title: SARAL SIMS rolls out to ease steel import regs for MSMEs
items.summary:
- *SARAL SIMS* enables a yearly registration with a single number for all steel imports in that year, letting importers file multiple consignments under one registration.
- For small imports, there is an annual cap (500 MT until April 2026, then 1,000 MT from 2026-27) and exports under Advance Authorization/SEZ/EOU have no threshold; if cap is exceeded, regular SIMS applies. *MSMEs*
- The registration process is simplified: fields reduced from 56 to 20, and clarifications/NOC for non-QCO grades are removed, with generation via the SARAL SIMS portal at sims.steel.gov.in/SARAL.

items.title: EV boom, modular manufacturing drives cold-roll form demand
items.summary:
- The *EV* boom, modular infrastructure, and demand for *precision manufacturing* are fueling a surge in sheet-metal *cold-roll forming*. 
- *Cold-roll forming* offers higher coil utilization, lower waste, and faster assembly across sectors like renewable energy, mobility, construction equipment, and elevators. 
- Industry expects the trend to boost *Make in India* and *Atmanirbhar Bharat*, expanding domestic and export supply chains for high-precision metal components.

items.title: Centre to host Bharat Steel-2026 Summit
items.author: TNN
items.summary:
- Bharat Steel-2026 is a *two-day expo* in *New Delhi* on *April 16–17, 2026* to showcase mega steel projects in states like *Odisha*, *Jharkhand*, and others.
- *Odisha* aims to be the steel capital, targeting *130 MTPA by 2030* and contributing a large share of output.
- The summit will bring together producers, policymakers, investors and lenders to discuss *global trends*, *raw-material security*, and *green steel* with a focus on *co-developing mega projects*.

items.title: MAN Industries, Aramco sign 5-year MoU for Saudi steel pipe
items.summary:
- The MoU between MAN Industries (India) and Aramco Asia India is effective for five years and aims to explore setting up a *steel pipe facility* in *Saudi Arabia* via MAN or its subsidiaries.
- The partners will collaborate to develop capabilities, technologies and resources to support energy, infrastructure and industrial needs in the *GCC* and wider Middle East.
- MAN Industries highlights its proven track record of delivering *high-quality line pipe solutions* to major energy projects.

items.title: Hiring momentum rises 5.5% in manufacturing, engineering and infrastructure: Report
In the age of electronics, General Instruments shows why the mechanical core still counts
Jeh Aerospace opens Hyderabad Mach 2 facility
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- *Mach 2* facility spans about 200,000 sq ft in *Horizon Industrial Park* near Kothur, expanding Jeh Aerospace’s Hyderabad footprint to over 250,000 sq ft.
- It will be operational in 2026 and will use *autonomous machining*, *digital twins*, and *closed-loop quality systems* for a software-defined aerospace manufacturing site.
- Jeh Aerospace founder and CEO Vishal Sanghavi calls the expansion a foundation for a new manufacturing paradigm at the intersection of *Talent*, *Technology*, and *Transformation*.

items.title: India to match global chipmaking leaders by 2032: Ashwini Vaishnaw
Nvidia CEO rejects AI bubble fears as profits soar
items.author: ETEnterpriseAI Desk
items.summary:
- Nvidia posted $31.9B in profit and $57B in quarterly revenue, up ~60% YoY, driven mainly by *data-centre GPUs*, including $50M in H-20 GPUs for China.
- CEO Jensen Huang rejected AI‑bubble fears, saying demand for GPUs signals a *long-term upgrade cycle* and AI will spawn new software categories and **agentic AI**.
- Nvidia’s valuation tops **$4.5T** as it positions for sustained AI infrastructure growth, with next-quarter revenue guided around ₹65B (~$3B) above estimates.

items.title: Tsuyo signs LoI with Karnataka to set up EV powertrain plant, testing track in Dharwad
India to match global chipmaking leaders by 2032: Ashwini Vaishnaw
ACME Solar commissions another 16 MW of its 100 MW Gujarat wind project
RISC V could anchor India’s national semiconductor mission: UST’s Gilroy Mathew
Heavy Industries Ministry likely to trim PLI-Auto outlay to ₹2,000 crore: Report
Industry bodies seek relief measures as India's textile exports fall 12.9% in Oct on US tariffs
Global liquor giants seek $337 million overdue payment from Indian state
US clears $93 million sale of Excalibur, Javelin defence systems to India
Indkal forays into smartphone biz under Wobble brand with ₹225 cr initial investment
Afghan commerce minister seeks support for exports, imports from India
Auto industry seeks solution on ₹2,500-cr cess credits
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary: - The auto industry is pressing the government to fix about *₹2,500 crore* in compensation cess credits that lapsed after the GST 2.0 rollout.\n- The credits sit in dealer accounts and cannot be carried forward under *GST 2.0*, prompting the Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) to seek Supreme Court relief, while SIAM highlights dealer impact.\n- The pre-Budget talks also covered ease of doing business and GST portal challenges, with calls for smoother compliance ahead of the Budget.

items.title: Novartis to build hub in North Carolina, 700 jobs
items.summary: - **Novartis** will build a hub in **Durham** with two facilities and a site in **Morrisville** for *biologics manufacturing* and packaging, opening by 2027–2028.\n- The project is part of a **$23B US infrastructure** plan and will create about **700 new jobs** at Novartis plus thousands in the supply chain by 2030.\n- The expansion will boost domestic production from the **Durham** campus and aligns with a broader US–Swiss deal to spur investment (up to **$200B** by 2028).

items.title: Infra push, sops for exporters to boost construction equipment sector: JCB India CEO
Centre to recast steel sector emission targets after errors found in carbon credit calculations
Trump's semiconductor tariff plan likely delayed
Phenomenal opportunity in India: Cisco's Rensburg
Addverb partners with institutes to boost robotics education
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Addverb has formed partnerships with IITs, NAMTECH and NIIT Neemrana to establish **Centres of Excellence** in robotics and automation.
- It will supply cobots, AGVs, AMRs, shuttles and its quadruped robot *Trakr* to support research, training and industry-linked projects at subsidised CoEs.
- The initiative aims to widen access to *robotics education* and strengthen industry-academia links in India.

items.title: India’s construction equipment market set for strong expansion: JCB
Nvidia uses phone memory, could double server prices by 2026
items.author: Eduardo Baptista
items.summary:
- Nvidia's pivot to smartphone-style **LPDDR** memory for AI servers could push **server-memory prices** toward a double by 2026.
- The shift from **DDR5** to LPDDR aims to cut power costs but risks creating sudden demand and supply-chain stress for memory suppliers.
- **Counterpoint Research** warns this seismic move could reshape memory markets, affecting cloud providers, AI developers, and data-centre budgets.

items.title: China's largest chipmaker is worried about near future of smartphones, laptops and gadgets
Moderna to complete US mRNA manufacturing network
items.summary:
- Moderna will operate full *end-to-end* mRNA drug product manufacturing in the US, onshoring production at its *Norwood, Massachusetts* campus.
- The company is investing over *$140 million* to add the final *fill-finish* step, supporting commercial and clinical supply and creating hundreds of *biomanufacturing jobs*.
- This move reduces *reliance on contract manufacturers*, strengthens *domestic supply chains*, and could shape long-term *US biopharma strategies*.

items.title: Railways, ROQIT launch AI parcel platform
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- The project starts with a pilot on South Central Railway in early 2026, expanding later nationwide, to replace paper processes with predictive scheduling, instant booking, digital payments and *real-time tracking*.
- ROQIT will provide a cloud-native app for door-to-door parcel services, a marketplace to choose partners, and an electric-mobility backbone via *ETO Motors* for green, *zero-emission* movement.
- Indian Railways aims to grow small-parcel traffic, improve reliability, and support a near-100% green transport capability aligned with the *Net-Zero vision*.

items.title: Servotech wins ₹73.7 Cr rooftop solar project
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - *Servotech Renewable Power System* won a ₹73.7 crore grid-connected rooftop solar project under the **PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana**, marking a milestone in distributed-energy deployment.\n- The project will deploy rooftop systems across **Kavali division** and will serve 5,886 *SC/ST households*, with Servotech handling design, engineering, supply, installation, testing and commissioning plus five years of O&M.\n- It uses a utility-led aggregation model to boost access to *grid-connected solar power* for underserved communities, aligning with India's clean-energy goals.
keywords: PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana

items.title: L&T, BAE Systems bags defence contract for BvS10 vehicles from Indian Army
Adani-Bondada tie-up for renewable energy design and build
items.summary:
- *Bondada Engineering* signed a five-year framework with *Adani Group* to establish a long-term strategic design and construction partnership in the *renewable energy* sector.
- The first tranche awards *Bondada* 650 MW of solar construction from *Adani Green Energy*, with the signing in Ahmedabad on Nov 18 by Vineet Jain and Bondada Raghavendra Rao.
- *Bondada* will be a strategic partner for the 30 GW Khavda renewables park in Gujarat; the firm has 1 GW commissioned and 1.8 GW under execution.

items.title: Concord subsidiary wins ₹19.17 cr Indian Railways order
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- **Advanced Rail Controls**, the wholly‑owned subsidiary of *Concord Control Systems*, has won a ₹19.17 crore order from **Indian Railways** for a **loco wireless control system**. 
- The contract covers supply, installation and commissioning and will be executed in seven months, with end‑to‑end delivery and no related‑party interests. 
- This win reinforces *Concord Control Systems*'s footprint in **railway control technology** and aligns with IR's safety and efficiency goals.

items.title: Calderys debuts basic monolithics in Odisha facility
items.summary: - *Calderys* has commissioned its *basic monolithics* production line at a new facility in *Odisha*, as part of the CAPES project to expand in India.\n- The CAPES plant, spanning 45 acres, will host six lines for *acidic and basic monolithics and bricks*, with full-scale production expected in the second half of 2026.\n- The move aims to boost sectors like steel, cement, aluminium, petrochemicals and mining, support exports in APAC, and advance India’s *Make in India* and *Atmanirbhar Bharat* goals.

items.title: NTPC Green 75.5 MW at Khavda-I, Gujarat
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary: - NTPC Green Energy (**NGEL**) commissioned 75.5 MW at *Khavda-I solar project* in *Gujarat* and declared it commercially operational on Nov 19, 2025. - With this expansion, **NGEL**'s commercial capacity rises to 7,563 MW, and total installed capacity reaches 7,639 MW. - The project is under the CPSU Scheme Phase-II, Tranche-III by **NTPC Renewable Energy**, reinforcing the nation's move toward *renewable energy*.

items.title: Inox Green to manage O&M for 5-GW wind–solar projects of INOXGFL, KP Group
Goyal to visit Israel for trade, tech and investment talks
items.summary: - Commerce and Industry Minister *Piyush Goyal* will visit *Israel* with a 60-member delegation to advance bilateral cooperation in *trade*, *technology* and *investment*.\n- He will participate in the *India–Israel Business Forum*, and the fourth *CEOs Forum* to discuss partnerships and investments.\n- The talks will cover collaboration in *agriculture*, water, defence, emerging technologies, life sciences, infrastructure and the proposed *India–Israel Free Trade Agreement*.

items.title: Azad Eng shares rise after Pratt & Whitney pact
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary: - Azad Engineering shares rose about 2% after signing a strategic pact with **Pratt & Whitney Canada Corporation** to collaborate on developing and manufacturing *aircraft engine components*.\n- The framework aims to bolster Azad's aerospace capabilities and strengthen its order book, supplementing a prior ₹651 crore deal with Mitsubishi Heavy Industries that lifts total MHI value to ₹1,387 crore.\n- In Q2 FY26, Azad reported net profit ₹33 crore on revenue ₹145.6 crore, with EBITDA ₹53.2 crore and margins at 36.5%.

items.title: Inox Solar & KPI to develop 2.5 GW solar across India
items.summary:
- *Inox Solar* and *KPI Green Energy* signed an exclusive *Memorandum of Understanding (MoU)* to develop **2.5 GW** of *solar and hybrid renewable-energy* projects across multiple states, with Inox supplying modules and overseeing *pre-commissioning*, *commissioning*, and *O&M* for the modules.
- KPI will handle project development, including *land acquisition*, *connectivity*, *statutory approvals*, and execution of balance-of-plant and *EPC* works.
- The partnership fuses **manufacturing and engineering capabilities** with *KPI’s development expertise* to drive faster, large-scale *clean energy deployment* across India.

items.title: MeitY aims $150B via components
items.summary: - *S Krishnan* says the goal is to achieve about $150B through *component manufacturing* and exports as part of a $500B electronics target.\n- The scheme, **ECMS**, aims to deepen India’s value chain and make electronics manufacturing globally competitive, not tariff-driven.\n- 17 **ECMS** projects worth ₹7,172 crore were approved, bringing total to 24 across nine states.

items.title: Textiles PLI: 17 new applicants approved
items.summary:
- The Ministry has approved *17 new applicants* under the PLI for Textiles in Round 3.
- These projects involve an investment of **₹2,374 crore** and are expected to generate sales of **₹12,893 crore** while employing about **22,646 people**.
- The PLI scheme targets *MMF apparel*, *MMF fabrics*, and *Technical Textiles* to boost domestic manufacturing and global competitiveness, with the online portal reopened till **31 December 2025**.

items.title: Uttar Pradesh frames energy roadmap to become green leader by 2047
Steel minister opens SAIL Rourkela facility
items.summary: - Union minister *H D Kumaraswamy* inaugurated a modern *steel-making facility* at SAIL's Rourkela Steel Plant and launched the *Caster-4 unit*.\n- Plans to more than double capacity to around *9 MTPA* with about *Rs 30,000 crore* investment.\n- Expansion aims to boost supplies to defence, oil and gas, and automobiles with sustained government support.
